Climate and Soil.soil_type: Well drained loamy soils, rich in humus, with fairly good content of potash.
Climate and Soil.soil_conditions: The soil should be well aerated. Heavy soil should be avoided. The bulbs produced on sandy or loose soils are deformed and do not keep well in storage.
Climate and Soil.climate: It is grown under a wide range of climatic conditions, but cannot stand too hot or too cold weather.
Climate and Soil.temperature: Prefers moderate temperature in summer as well as in winter.
Climate and Soil.day_length: Short days are very favorable for the formation of bulbs.

Planting Habits.scope: The smooth, glaucous scope grows from 1 to 3 feet high. The scope or stem is hollow and swollen above the base.
Planting Habits.flowers: Terminal, umbel, white or faint blue, numerous, develop bulbels.
Planting Habits.bulb: Underground bulb undeveloped like the stem.

nursery_sowing_time.plains: middle of October to the end of November

Irrigation.guideline: Irrigation during growth should be steady and uninterrupted otherwise dryness may cause splitting of the outer scales.
Irrigation.stopping_point: Irrigation is stopped when the tops mature and start falling.
Irrigation.yield_tip: Use F1 hybrids for higher yield.

Pest.Maggot: Apply Thimet 10G to soil and spray Malathion (0.05%)

Yield.post_harvest_note: Bulbs should be thoroughly cured before storage.

Fertilizers and water management.influence: Doses of fertilizers, type of fertilizers and irrigation affects the storing capacity of onion / shelf life of onion.
Fertilizers and water management.organic_matter_effect: Increases the storing capacity of onion.
Fertilizers and water management.irrigation: According to soil tag crop should be irrigated.

Drying of onion.process: Immediately after harvest let the onion should get dried for about 8 to 10 days.
Drying of onion.benefits: Helps to remove the excess heat giving better colour to onion.

adverse_conditions.decrease_in_humidity: Increases respiration rate causing weight loss.
adverse_conditions.may_june: More temperature and less relative humidity affects the weight loss.
adverse_conditions.july_september: Temperature goes down resulting in sprouting of onion.

Actual storage conditions.recommendation: Construction of proper storage structure is required.

guidelines: Storage structure should be constructed 30cm from the ground level giving cement base which avoids contact with soil moisture.
For roofing purpose sugarcane trash, asbestos sheet is used which lowers down the temperature.
For good aeration central height should be optimum (120cm) giving sloppy structure.
Care should be taken that the stored onions should not get directly expose to sunlight which gives good colour and improves the structure of onion.
Construction of storage structure.stabilization: Before and after storage of the storage structure can be done by spraying 10g Bavistin + 15ml neuocron in 10 liters of water which helps in controlling the pest.
